Title: new feature: git graph
Body:
I have this alias on my `.gitconfig` file:

``` git
[alias]
    graph = log --graph --date-order -C -M --pretty=format:\"<%h> %ad [%an] %Cgreen%d%Creset %s\" --all --date=short
```

it displays a nice graph with all the commits, branches names, etc:

![graph](http://i.imgur.com/31MPB.png)

May be useful to somebody else, since I added this alias I stopped using `gitk` completely.

source: http://stackoverflow.com/a/6212370
repo_description: GIT utilities -- repo summary, repl, changelog population, author commit percentages and more

Title: Dragging on <svg> gives I-bar cursor
Body:
When dragging (click-drag-release) on an SVG element, webkit changes the cursor to an I-bar.

This is also documented below:
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7434147/dragging-cursor-on-svg-element-changes-cursor-to-i-beam-e-g-on-webkit-chro
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2745028/chrome-sets-cursor-to-text-while-dragging-why

I can confirm this is a webkit-only bug, I've tested positive for the bug in Safari, Chrome and Chrome Canary. This bug does not happen in Firefox or Opera.

Example: Drag the mouse within the <svg> element here: http://raphaeljs.com/pie.html

I can confirm that none of the fixes listed at the first stackoverflow page work. Going to go submit a bug on the webkit project now, will link here when I have done so.

Title: Git repository shrinkage
Body:
Remove large unused files from the git repository (UI Mockups, libsnes.a, old XADMaster, old .dmgs, etc). This will make checkouts ~50% smaller/faster.

Kind of hard though, it requires history rewrites (downstream forks will be broken and everyone will need to re-checkout) and some changes will make very old commits unbuildable and therefore only good as reference. I don't think this is a problem.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/298314/find-files-in-git-repo-over-x-megabytes-that-dont-exist-in-head

Title: Option to prevent automatic conversion of return/param types
Body:
The current code generator produces simple functions which forward method calls on an interface type to the underlying concrete type, automatic conversions for parameter and return types are permitted.  This is useful in some cases but may not be desirable sometimes.

It might be useful to provide an option to prevent automatic conversion of paramater or return types, so that the return/parameter types in a concrete type must exactly match the interface type.

This could possibly be done using a technique such as those described in http://stackoverflow.com/questions/175689/can-you-use-keyword-explicit-to-prevent-automatic-conversion-of-method-parameter
repo_description: Go-like interface generator for C++

Title: ClientSide Image-Scaling
Body:
Mir ist grad so ne Idee gekommen wie man den ganzen "Ich hab zuwenig Speicher auf meinem Server um meine 20 Megapixel Digicam Bilder zu skalieren!" oder "Ich brauche ne halbe Ewigkeit um meine 100 Bilder á 20 Megapixel hochzuladen!"-Kram abschaffen kann.

HTML5 FileAPI + Canvas

Vorgehensweise:
- Lokale Datei wird ausgewählt (via DnD oder Dateiauswahldialog)
- Datei wird auf Bild geprüft, wenn kein Bild dann normal Uploaden, wenn Bild dann weiter
- Bild skaliert in eine Canvas zeichnen (mit verschiedenen Graka Optimierungen wie AA/Filtering)
- Canvas.toDataURL() mit entsprechendem Bildtyp aufrufen
- Die skalierten B64 Daten an den Server schicken
- Server dekodiert B64 zu Binary und schreibt in ne Datei

Die Standard-Bild-Maximal-Größe für Uploads kann man vorgeben (wie jetzt auch), aber auch via Reiter "Experten-Konfiguration" Individuell anpassen (um automatisches Skalieren zu verhindern).

Ein paar Ressourcen zu dem Thema:
http://www.nihilogic.dk/labs/canvas2image/
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/371875/local-file-access-with-javascript
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4761711/local-image-in-canvas-in-chrome
http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/file/filesystem/
http://www.html5rocks.com/en/tutorials/file/dndfiles/

PS: Wenn toDataURL nicht klappt, könnte man auch Pixel für Pixel aus der Canvas auslesen, das Zippen, an den Server schicken, da wieder Pixel für Pixel in ne GD Canvas zeichnen und damit dann die Format Speicherung durchführen (gegebenenfalls mit PNG FilterOptimierung blablub)
repo_description: Contao Extension :: Multiple file uploader without flash

Title: Build and install library
Body:
At the moment `src/Makefile` doesn't create a library, just an object file.
We want a library so that other programs can link it and also a `make install`.

Here is an example Makefile that might work:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/885451/makefile-for-shared-libraries

If this does work on the common systems (Linux and Mac with gcc and clang) I'd much prefer this simple solution over using autotools.

Also what compile options do we want? At the moment we have this:

```
CFLAGS=-Wall -g -std=c99 #-march=native -pipe -fomit-frame-pointer 
```

Ramin, I had to comment out some of the options you had used to make it work on my Mac.
I guess we want `-03` and not `-g` for speed tests?
Do you think we should use  `march`, `pipe` or `fomit-frame-pointer` for some reason?
repo_description: Fast C library for image ring- and tophat-correlation with python bindings
bio: Python | Data | Science

Title: Server crash after clients quit playing matches
Body:
I cannot seem to reliably reproduce this, I've only seen it once. But server crashes are serious, so here is what I know about it:

I was testing two clients out in the Ogre3D code, then quit out of the Ogre code back into the match lobby when the server spit out:

RTT_Server: malloc.c:4631: _int_malloc: Assertion `(unsigned long)(size) >= (unsigned long)(nb)' failed.
Aborted

Judging from this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7759696/what-does-this-error-suggest I would say that the error is due to us not deleting on object when we should. We'll have to take a close look at data reads from the server.

Running the server under valgrind would also be a good idea.
repo_description: Real Time Tactics (RTT) Game

Title: Failed to build 1.48.0 under Mac OS X Lion
Body:
When building, it stops at building shared library of chrono, which says undefined reference to some symbols in system module.

From the linking.txt, seems like the linking command doesn't link the other dependence libraries.  This works for linux system, but for on MacOSX, leaving undefined symbols there will cause linker errors:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3695234/what-is-the-deal-with-undefined-symbols-in-a-shared-library-or-dylib

I wonder if anyone else has succeeded building on Mac so it is just my misconfiguration of toolchains (I used macports).

Another question is if it really has issues building on Mac, then do you have any plan to support the Mac platform?

Thanks.

Title: Fix for disabled SubmitControl objects with no value
Body:
Stop mechanize from crashing with an AttributeError when attempting to select a form a SubmitControl that has no value and is also disabled.

When mechanize encounters a SubmitControl with no value (such as an ImageControl) it attempts to set the value to a blank string. This fails if the control is disabled (mechanize raises an AttributeError). This patch temporarily sets disabled to False in this situation and then immediately resets it to True after the blank string has been assigned to value.

Title: Implement a better SVMSearch algorithm
Body:
Currently, SVMSearch performs something like two nested for loops and tries to find a combination of parameters that satisfies the required maximum error. While it uses constant steps for both C and Gamma, this can be a very lengthy process (esp. when the ranges are big) and finding optimal values is not guaranteed.

A better algorithm should be implemented, for example: 'A pattern search (also known as a “compass search” or a “line search”) starts at the center of the search range and makes trial steps in each direction for each parameter. If the fit of the model improves, the search center moves to the new point and the process is repeated. If no improvement is found, the step size is reduced and the search is tried again. The pattern search stops when the search step size is reduced to a specified tolerance.' (http://www.dtreg.com/svm.htm)

Another link for inspiration: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2761240/how-to-figure-out-optimal-c-gamma-parameters-in-libsvm (includes link to "The Entire Regularization Path for the Support Vector Machine" paper).

[ Footnote: Claiming "Support vector machines do not suffer from overfitting" (http://www.heatonresearch.com/wiki/Support_Vector_Machine) is not quite correct as it depends on the parameters. ]

Title: Add ability to disable paperclip-meta via an option
Body:
I'm using STI to store info about attachments (images and non-images) in the DB.  Because it's STI, the table includes one meta column shared by both classes.

When I upload a non-image, paperclip-meta tries to process it and causes "identify: no decode delegate" warnings in the logs (Mac OSX Lion, ImageMagick 6.7.4-6).

I would like to be able to disable paperclip-meta for attachments even when a meta column is present in the DB.  For instance:

``` ruby
class FileAttachment < ActiveRecord::Base
  # Don't process non-images
  has_attached_file :attachment, :meta => lambda { |s| ... }, :styles => lambda { |s| ... } 
end
```

Is that possible?  Maybe there's a way, I just didn't see it in the docs.

**Edit:** ala http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5289674/paperclip-process-images-only, only controlling whether or not meta info is loaded instead of which styles get generated.
repo_description: Adds width, height, and size to paperclip images.

Title: Solaris compatibility
Body:
Hello!

I had trouble compiling stud on Solaris (specifically a Joyent smartmachine) so I made a few patches that affect the `Makefile` and `stud.c`.

Notes on the patches:

Using `fcntl()` and `O_NONBLOCK` is more portable than `ioctl` and `FIONBIO` on Unix (See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1150635/unix-nonblocking-i-o-o-nonblock-vs-fionbio#1151077 and also the libev source code).  Apparently `FIONBIO` is the way to do it on Windows.  I can change this to be inside a Solaris-specific #define if you'd like.

For the fclose()/fopen() -> freopen() change I was getting the following error from gcc:

```
stud.c:1812: error: lvalue required as left operand of assignment
```

For the USE_KEEPIDLE define, I wasn't sure if you'd rather this was defined in the Makefile or inside of stud.c itself.  I can easily change it to your preference.  Solaris doesn't let you tune the keep-alive interval per-socket, but does allow tuning it for the whole system via the `ndd` tool.

Let me know if there's any questions; I'm happy to have a conversation about these patches and make any changes you see fit.  

Note: I haven't done any significant testing of it (other than one-off testing), so if you're worried about stability I can wait, do some more testing, then get back to you.

Cheers,
~stash

Title: Display image in the result
Body: How can I configure the result to render a image? ``` ruby def json_for_autocomplete(items, method, extra_data=[]) items.collect do |item| if item.is_a?(Category) hash = {"id" => item.id.to_s, "label" => item.send('photo').html_safe, "value" => item.send(method)} else hash = {"id" => item.id.to_s, "label" => item.send(method), "value" => item.send(method)} end extra_data.each do |datum| hash[datum] = item.send(datum) end if extra_data # TODO: Come back to remove this if clause when test suite is better hash end end ``` I modify the method like this, but it rendered a string as '' How can I render a image in the list? thanks

Title: Issues using AnythingSlider in a pluto portlet
Body:
I've got a porlet setup to display text/images using the AnythingSlider.  Each slide has very little decoration (maybe some bold text) and then an image.

My portal has multiple "pages" of portlets.

JQuery is used heavily throughout this portal for other parts of an internal framework I am using.  We are on version 1.8.12.

So the problem comes in when moving from the portal page with my AnythingSlider portlet to one of the other portal pages.  In the IE 9 developer tools I see a script error but it doesn't point to anything meaningful that I can tell.  When I click back to the page with the AnythingSlider portlet then the slider has stopped working.  I can't even click on the tabs to move from one item to the next.

If I stop the slider before clicking to another portal page then I don't see the script error and when I click back to the page with the AnythingSlider portlet then the slider works just fine.

Of course none of this is a problem in Firefox.

Is there anything I can do about this?  I thought about catching the window.unload event in order to stop the slider programatically, but this doesn't execute when moving from one portal page to another.

Title: Unicode support for links
Body:
Take the following textile link example: ``` "Superhuman":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superhuman "Übermensch":https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Übermensch ``` This will be rendered as: ```

Superhuman
“Übermensch”:https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Übermensch

``` The second link will not be parsed correctly, since it contains the Unicode character 'Ü'. This happens because the _links()_ function uses _A-Za-z_ in the regular expression: ``` python pattern = r''' (?P
[\s\[{(]|[%s])?         #leading text
            "                               #opening quote
            (?P%s)                    #block attributes
            (?P[^"]+?)                #link text
            \s?
            (?:\((?P[^)]+?)\)(?="))? #optional title
            ":                              #closing quote, colon
            (?P<url>(?:ftp|https?)?         #URL
                        (?: :// )?
                        [-A-Za-z0-9+&@#/?=~_()|!:,.;%%]*
                        [-A-Za-z0-9+&@#/=~_()|]
            )
            (?P<post>[^\w\/;]*?)        #trailing text
            (?=<|\s|$)
        ''' % (re.escape(punct), self.c)

        text = re.compile(pattern, re.X).sub(self.fLink, text)
```

Instead, _\w_ in combination with the _re.UNICODE_ flag should be used:

``` python
        pattern = r'''
            (?P<pre>[\s\[{(]|[%s])?         #leading text
            "                               #opening quote
            (?P<atts>%s)                    #block attributes
            (?P<text>[^"]+?)                #link text
            \s?
            (?:\((?P<title>[^)]+?)\)(?="))? #optional title
            ":                              #closing quote, colon
            (?P<url>(?:ftp|https?)?         #URL
                        (?: :// )?
                        [-\w+&@#/?=~()|!:,.;%%]*
                        [-\w+&@#/=~()|]
            )
            (?P<post>[^\w\/;]*?)        #trailing text
            (?=<|\s|$)
        ''' % (re.escape(punct), self.c)

        text = re.compile(pattern, re.X | re.UNICODE).sub(self.fLink, text)
```

There are other occurences of the _a-z_ or _A-Z_ expression in the source code... they should maybe replaced too.
repo_description: Please see textile/python-textile at

Error: No such file or directory - /Users/chaines/Error:

Title: WebSocket connection fails from 3G
Body:
The WebSocket connection does not complete: the request is sent but there is no response.

(cometd.js line 1049)
_webSocket = new window.WebSocket(url);

See a more detailed description here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5557776/websockets-over-a-3g-connection

I suggest to put a new configuration property (connectionTimeout) default to 1 second, and create a timer which will end the websocket connection if we didn't get any response in any callback within the timeout, and thus fallback to long-polling.

We need this patch right now so I am going to develop it and upload it so that you can review.
repo_description: The CometD project, a scalable comet (server push) implementation for web messaging.
bio: Programmer. Jetty & CometD. Webtide Lead Architect. Java Champion.

Title: SEC-1915: Add cutomisation of search filter in ActiveDirectoryLdapAuthenticationProvider
Body:
[Tseliso Molukanele](https://jira.spring.io/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=tseliso%20molukanele) (Migrated from [SEC-1915](https://jira.spring.io/browse/SEC-1915)) said:

Currently the search filter used when retrieving user details is hard coded to '(&(objectClass=user)(userPrincipalName={0}))'.

When this hard coded filter is not consistent with the actual active directory instance it causes a org.springframework.dao.IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException because the search returns with empty results after successful authentication.

A possible solution is to modify the class org.springframework.security.ldap.authentication.ad.ActiveDirectoryLdapAuthenticationProvider to allow a configurable search filter via bean configuration.

Another possible solution is to make the class org.springframework.security.ldap.authentication.ad.ActiveDirectoryLdapAuthenticationProvider extendable instead of final with protected instead of private functional methods to allow for easier customisation.

See question 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9258047/spring-security-3-1-active-directory-authentication

Title: X-Sendfile and X-Accel-Redirect support
Body:
While Ruby/Rack is fine to be an intermediary to handle permission/authentication, it's not the best tool at reading/sending files. A better solution can be to delegate it to the webserver (Apache2/Nginx), with X-Sendfile and X-Accel-Redirect HTTP responses.

You can read more about then here: 

http://wiki.nginx.org/XSendfile
https://tn123.org/mod_xsendfile/

All you have to do is craft a HTTP response code with one of the two (configurable) and append the path for the file resource and let the webserver handle the file transmission.

Title: Cache results of getCapabilities (optional)
Body:
option: --cache

if this is set, the result of getCapabilities is stored on disc in a file

The name of the file containing xml for getCapabilites, is a hash of the site being tested....
the url is md5 hashed.

In python this is done with:

``` python
import hashlib
m = hashlib.md5()
m.update('http://kort.arealinfo.dk/wms')
m.hexdigest()
# '33497de04e08ac157cee9d5b133483e3'
```

We test the presence of 33497de04e08ac157cee9d5b133483e3.xml
If the file is older than a day, it is replaces.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/237079/how-to-get-file-creation-modification-date-times-in-python

Title: No way to order post or pages
Body:
I notice people search for how to order page and post lists in Jekyll Bootstrap. Just so there is a place where this question is answered: 

**There is currently no way to pragmatically order pages or posts.**

The posts are ordered chronologically, while the pages are ordered alphabetically (to my knowledge). 

The only way to create your own order is to manually create an array in the _config.yml or YAML Front Matter pointing to the post/page urls, then iterate over that array.

This is one of the biggest drawbacks to sticking with the Jekyll framework. I'm currently scheming a solution for this =)
repo_description: The quickest way to start and publish your Jekyll powered blog. 100% compatible with GitHub pages.
bio: [o_o] J[o_o] [o_o}

Title: Ember changes behavior of Array iteration
Body:
When Ember is in scope javascript iterates over an array in the following fashion: ``` javascript var a = [1,2,3] for (var i in a) {$('body').append(i + '
');} ``` it enumerates methods of the array prototype as in: > 0 > 1 > 2 > isEnumerable > nextObject > firstObject > ... Naturally it breaks few libraries in scope. Here are examples with and without Ember in scope: https://tinker.io/2f148/4 https://tinker.io/7ed87/1
repo_description: Ember.js - A JavaScript framework for creating ambitious web applications

Title: Safari+FF+Opera bug: Ended callback not firering after 2nd playback
Body:
It took me more than 5 hours to find this, since I really need to be able to make my current project work on the iPad.

The bug happens in a very particular way, on both desktop and mobile version of Safari, Opera, and FF. Chrome just seems to not be affected while I still did not bother testing anything on IE yet.

I have a html5 audio player that has BOTH a `ended` and `timeupdate` handler. The thing is the `timeupdate` always fires as it suppose too, but the `ended` callback was only called on the first media, not the other ones. Since my animation is based on the `ended` callabck, I tried to 'recreate' the ended event in the timeupdate one.

`if (status.currentTime != 0 && status.currentTime >= status.duration) { ... }` 

Everything works now perfectly. I even got rid of the unnecessary `ended` call when setting the media. But I am sure the bug resides elsewhere in jPlayer's code.
repo_description: jPlayer : HTML5 Audio & Video for jQuery

Title: Some git remotes do not support shallow clones
Body:
Some git remotes, in particular dumb http remotes, do not support the `--depth` flag. So setting `el-get-git-shallow-clone` to non-nil will cause installation to fail. 

I've pushed 72b411a which fixes some recipes by explicitly adding `:shallow nil`, but it would be nice if there was a fallback mechanism for when shallow cloning fails, or a way to automatically detect whether a remote supports shallow cloning.

I've asked about this on Stack Overflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9270488/is-it-possible-to-detect-whether-a-http-git-remote-is-smart-or-dumb

Title: Keep screen on using android:keepScreenOn attribute
Body:
Hi @kevinsawicki - I wanted to check this tweak is good with you, unless you've already tried and rejected it?

Using `android:keepScreenOn` (which is added here to the airtraffic layout xml) doesn't require asking for the additional
WAKE_LOCK permission and also removes responsibility for managing the lock (the WindowManager takes care of keeping the sceen on so long as the activity shows) so I think it's generally preferred to the PowerManager method.

Tested on Galaxy Nexus - kept the screen on for the 5 minutes or so I was
watching it.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4376902/difference-between-wakelock-and-flag-keep-screen-on
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2131948/force-screen-on
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUemfrKe65c#t=1850s
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/view/WindowManager.LayoutParams.html#FLAG_KEEP_SCREEN_ON

reverts commit 83f18db9bd428a29d7f9ec178a517c9f2fc0e3c6.

Title: Complete callback behavior for multiple yepnope calls
Body:
Hi,

not sure it's a bug, but it seems like a change in behavior of the complete callback.
Previously, when calling yepnope multiple times, like so:

```
yepnope(['jquery.js', 'other.js']);

// ....later
yepnope({complete:function(){ console.log('lets go!', jQuery) }});
```

The complete callback in the 2nd call would fire once all files from the 1st call had been downloaded. Now it fires immediately, resulting in jQuery being undefined in the example above.

I also came across this question on stackoverflow, which uses the same technique: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7344843/yepnopes-complete-callback-question

Unfortunately I can't say when it changed, as I was using the Modernizr packaged version. I can't find out which yepnope version was packed with Modernizr 2.5.1, which used to work for me. Modernizr 2.5.3 and yepnope 1.5.3 are different.

Cheers, Thomas.

Title: Need "no" locale in addition to "nb" and "nn"
Body:
It seems Norwegian language support isn't ideal in Android. There are two written forms of Norwegian, which each have their own ISO code: Norwegian bokmål (nb) and Norwegian Nynorsk (nn). Unfortunately "Norwegian" without any for specification also has an ISO code: no.

By law they are equal in Norway, but in practice, bokmål is far more prevalent and in use (80-90 % of written text is probably bokmål).

It seems both no and nb are used in Android: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5153674/android-localization-question

The only practical way to solve this seems to be to have two copies of Norwegian bokmål, one under "nb" and one under "no". Symbolic links are not supported on FAT filesystems, and thus the app cant be moved to memory cards, string aliases doesn't seem to be practical as one would still need to make the string files containing aliases(?), and I don't know of any way to "prioritize" languages (if no "no", then use "nb").

I've added a readme file to all folders containing nb and no noting that they should be kept in sync.

The "nb" Android market text should probably also be copied to "no".

Title: NH 3044: Linq Self-joined query with subquery and order by - order by didn't apply the outer query
Body:
following query: 

``` csharp
var query = from log in _session.Query<Log>() 
    where log == _session.Query<Log>()
        .OrderByDescending(l => l.DatePublished)
        .First(l => l.ServiceName == log.ServiceName) 
    orderby log.ServiceName 
    select log; 
```

The sql that gets generated looks like this: 

``` sql
select log0_.Id as Id1_, 
       log0_.DatePublished as DatePubl2_1_, 
       log0_.ServiceName as ServiceN3_1_, 
       log0_.Version as Version1_ 
from Log log0_ 
where log0_.Id = (select TOP (1) log1_.Id 
                          from Log log1_ 
                          where log1_.ServiceName = log0_.ServiceName 
                          order by log1_.DatePublished desc, 
                                    log0_.ServiceName asc); 
```

Notice the ordering from "orderby log.ServiceName" ends up being shoved into the subquery, which is wrong. The resulting set will not be sorted.

JIRA: https://nhibernate.jira.com/browse/NH-3044
repo_description: NHibernate Object Relational Mapper

Title: Fix some indent problems
Body:
@njx 
- Pressing the TAB key on an empty line no longer inserts an additional tab.
- Fixed problem that occasionally added an additional space character when typing a tab.
- Disable built-in "electric chars" feature and replace with a less heavy-handed version. The new version does the following:
  - Only runs when closing braces are typed: "]", "}", or ")"
  - Only runs if the line is all whitespace (except the closing brace)
    This should eliminate the majority of the odd and unpredictable auto-indent behaviors.

This fixes issues #155 and #193.

Title: Global configurations
Body:
## Feedback

I would love to get some feedback on some of the additional configuration property methods that I added and your thoughts and commits on this idea in general. I'm not in love with what is going on here exactly but it does what it needs to do.
## Outline of Changes

Retrieving configuration at a target level should consult the project level. It now does that with this series of commits.
- Projects now have a `global_config(name)` and `global_configs`
- Targets and Projects are now `ConfigurationOwners`
- Classes can now be assigned more than one module from the Registry based on the `isa`
- Added a few missing attributes to the configuration.
- Configuration getter will look at the project configuration if no key is defined for the property
- Configuration properties now have `raw_#property` setter/getters
- Configuration properties now have `env_#property` to return the name of the property (e.g. `env_prefix_header` would return 'GCC_PREFIX_HEADER'
- Configuration properties now have `append_#property` which will append a value correctly to the values stored.
- Fixed bug with ArrayProperty
- Added a new KeyValueArrayProperty for arrays of [ "KEY=VALUE", "KEY2=VALUE2" ]

Title: Scoring features to mark dead stones and count territory
Body:
I've tested this with my own SDK, but you should test it too before putting it live.  A few things to note:
- The code is probably a little rough.  I tried not to do anything _too_ ugly, but we may differ on what that means.  If you want me to clean things up before you pull, just let me know (but you'll have to tell me what you don't like).
- I left behind a README.deadstones that I used for planning (and updated as my plans changed).  Feel free to delete it, but for now you may find it helpful to figure out the control flow.
- The new images are placeholders.  I'll be disappointed if they go live :).  My thoughts: "territory-black" should be a small solid black circle in the centre of a transparent image and "dead-white" should be a small solid black circle in the centre of a white ghost stone.  In both cases, the grid background underneath should be (partially) exposed.  But it doesn't matter, as long as they're clear and they aren't as ugly as the placeholders.
- Old _unfinished_ games should end up going through scoring, just like new games, when the second player passes.
- Old _finished_ games will remain unmodified, and no winner is declared (even if one of the players resigned).

Title: Problems with models which have a polymorphic relationship.
Body:
Let us say I have a Foo and a Bar object. Both of them have many locations. Both define their relationship:

  { key: "locations", type: "HasMany", model: Location, reverseRelationship: {key: "locatable"}}

This will not work. Basically one of the models (first defined) will not get any locations children added, but will have the relationship. However it should be perfectly valid to do this:

  var foo = new Foo(...); foo.get('locations')[0].get('locatable') == foo; // true
  var bar = new Bar(...); bar.get('locations')[0].get('locatable') == bar; // true

Title: Custom backgrounds not working on ICS
Body:
We are using custom background drawables with ABS4. They work fine when running on Android 2.3 but on 4.0 the background drawables seem to be ignored. I've tried to make sure that we don't have problems in our definition code but as the behavior is different on two Android versions with the same code I think there might be an issue in the ABS code. We don't have any relevant platform specific style definitions in our code.

On 2.3 stacked mode & action mode

![2.3](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-2vffumX0Hbo/TzJQlLOIWtI/AAAAAAAAE-0/lhTJ-dWMUsI/s640/device-2012-02-08-112801.png) 

![2.3](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-9PjFiHEobIk/TzJQkw_FODI/AAAAAAAAE-w/xCCtXqurP30/s640/device-2012-02-08-112815.png)

The very same code running on ICS

![4.0](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-mMHdpQ3FFds/TzJQlQKxZMI/AAAAAAAAE-4/U4c-j-BOHxY/s640/device-2012-02-08-112741.png)

![4.0](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-lukDE4g5WB8/TzJQlPUPEoI/AAAAAAAAE-8/lTe1UTbpMNs/s640/device-2012-02-08-112753.png)

XML definitions for the action bar style are:

```
<style name="custom_ActionBar" parent="Widget.Sherlock.ActionBar">
    <item name="titleTextStyle">@style/custom_TitleStyle</item>
    <item name="background">@drawable/actionbarbackground</item>
    <item name="backgroundStacked">@drawable/actionbarbackground</item>
    <item name="backgroundSplit">@drawable/actionbarbackground</item>

</style>
```

---

Now, if I add this code to my activity:

```
        actionBar.setSplitBackgroundDrawable(getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.actionbarbackground));
        actionBar.setStackedBackgroundDrawable(getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.actionbarbackground));
        actionBar.setBackgroundDrawable(getResources().getDrawable(R.drawable.actionbarbackground));
```

it seems to enable top action bar bg drawable but everything else stays the same (action mode is still as above). 

![4.0 with extra code](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/--RnWEyy5_mo/TzJRgtAoCmI/AAAAAAAAE_k/Mvg2yXi52AY/s640/device-2012-02-08-114117.png)

Title: One action, Multiple namespaces
Body:
I am having difficulty understanding how to write actions DRY-ly.  Given that I have two namespaces (public and private) but I want the same action to be available to both namespaces, I cannot see a way around using the same member_action code in both locations.

```
ActiveAdmin.register DigitalAsset, :namespace => :public do

  member_action :copy do
    # Logic for copying
  end
end
```

```
ActiveAdmin.register DigitalAsset, :namespace => :private do

  member_action :copy do
    # Same logic for copying as used above in 'public' namespace
  end
end
```

It would seem obvious that I would want to define the 'copy' action in one controller that is available to both namespaces.  Is this something that is possible using ActiveAdmin 0.4.0?

Title: Does not support asterisk symbol in command
Body:
I'm trying to run this command through KennethReitz's Envoy package:

```
$ sqlite3 foo.db 'select * from sqlite_master' 
```

I've tried this:

```
r = envoy.run("sqlite3 foo.db 'select * from sqlite_master'")
sqlite3: Error: too many options: "*"
```

and this:

```
r = envoy.run(['sqlite3', 'foo.db', 'select * from sqlite_master'])
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'returncode'
```

additional quoting & escaping doesn't seem to help.  Any suggestions?

FYI: This is what I had to do for now:

```
cmd = "sqlite3 %(database)s 'select * from sqlite_master'" % locals()
os.system(cmd)
```

Note that this is a contrived example, and that most of the unix shell commands that I'd like to issue aren't just a simple select that could be easily done via SQLAlchemy.

From http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9106350/how-to-use-wildcards-with-envoy

Title: ExportToDatabase: Handling of booleans in SQLite
Body:
SQLite stores booleans as integers: http://www.sqlite.org/datatype3.html#boolean. This causes an error if per-object output from ClassifyObjects is written to the db. It would need to be stored as a 1/0 (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/843780/store-boolean-value-in-sqlite) or as a literal 'true'/'false' value (http://forums.realsoftware.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=3974). 

Looking again, seems like it would have to an integer based on get_measurement_columns in ClassifyObjects.

From this forum post: http://cellprofiler.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=14&t=1605&p=6432#p6432

Title: Option for reusing tiles added to TileLayer
Body:
I don't know if this is of general public interest, but for our application, reusing existing tiles is substantially faster than allocating memory for new ones. This of course depends on the amount of memory available - and the amount of scrolling you do. So feature-wise it is similar to the 'unloadInvisibleTiles' option, but it ought to be a bit faster since it does not need to free memory and acquire a similar memory chunk again. 

a '_resetTile (tile)' prototype has been added in case a subclass of TileLayer needs to do something special to clean up before a possible reuse.

Title: SERVER-991: Added support for $trim
Body:
The $trim operator will limit the length of the arrays to which
it is applied. A positive number indicates how many items to keep
starting counting from the beginning of the array whereas a negative
number keeps items from the end of the array.

  array: [1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8]
  trim(5)  -> keep 1 2 3 4 5, drop 6 7 8 -> [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
  trim(-5) -> drop 1 2 3, keep 4 5 6 7 8 -> [4, 5, 6, 7, 8]

$trim is special as it is allowed (and required) to reference the same
field as another update modifier. It can not be used by itself, but
the same effect can be used by doing a $pushAll: [](pushing an empty
list) at the same time as using $trim.

$trim is always performed after updating the field with any other
modifier.

Test cases have been added.

Title: Non-matching join operation
Body:
from @yarden on the mailing list

```
Hi,

I have a very common use case which pandas which involve a JOIN
operation related to coordinate arithmetic on two dataframes,
with queries like: for each entry in dataframe A, return all the
entries from dataframe B that have coordinates overlapping with
this entry. This join is not just matching on the columns values
of A and B, since the column values here are coordinates that
require simple arithmetic operations like intersection, overlap,
etc.

Following Wes's answer to someone else's question
here (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7837722/), I implemented
this in a naive way using iteration. My solution is extremely
inefficient however, probably in part since it is non-vectorized
and requires iterating through each element of the DataFrame.

Do you know of a more efficient/elegant way to do this?  The
naive implementation is unfortunately not workable for anything
even moderately large (e.g. dataframes with a couple thousand
entries.)

Complete example below. The first dataframe, df1, is made up of
two datasources, and each entry has a coordinate
column "loc1". The second dataframe df2 has an interval (start
and end coordinate) for each position. The "join" operation
function my_join() simply returns all the entry numbers in df2
that have intervals that contain the loc1 column from df1. The
join is not unique, so entries in df1 can be contained in
multiple entries in df2 (in which case they are stored as
comma-separated strings), or they can be contained in none of the
entries in df2, in which case the function stores the value
as "-1".

I'd like this to scale to instances where df1 and df2 contain
~50k entries. What is the best way to do this?

Thanks very much.

import pandas as p
import scipy
import numpy
# DataFrames for each data source
source1_data = np.array([0, 7, 2, 5, 0, 5, 4, 3, 9, 0, 4, 2, 5, 8, 0, 4, 0, 3, 3, 6])
source1_size = len(source1_data)
source1 = p.DataFrame({"id": range(source1_size),
                       "loc1": source1_data})
source1.set_index(["id"])
source2_data = np.array([8, 4, 1, 1, 9, 3, 7, 2, 8, 7])
source2_size = len(source2_data)
source2 = p.DataFrame({"id": range(source2_size),
                       "loc1": source2_data})
source2.set_index(["id"])
dataframe_dict = {"source1": source1,
                  "source2": source2}
# Concatenated into one DataFrame
df1 = p.concat(dataframe_dict, keys=["source1", "source2"])

df2_size = 6
# dataframe with intervals
intervals = np.array([[ 5,  6],
                      [ 3,  6],
                      [ 6, 13],
                      [ 7, 10],
                      [ 8,  9],
                      [ 9, 12]])
df2 = p.DataFrame({"entry": range(df2_size),
                   "coord1": intervals[:, 0],
                   "coord2": intervals[:, 1]})
# JOIN df1 and df2 based on interval containment
def my_join(first_df, second_df):
    all_hits = []
    for entry, value in first_df.T.iteritems():
        # Look for cases where loc1 field of df1 falls within
        # (coord1, coord2)
        coord = value["loc1"]
        hits = second_df.ix[(coord > second_df["coord1"]) & \
                            (coord < second_df["coord2"])]
        num_hits = len(hits)
        if num_hits == 0:
            hits = [-1]
        else:
            hits = hits["entry"].values
        # If there are any hits, record their entries in a
        # column of df1. When none, record them as -1
        print "%d falls within %d hits: " %(coord, num_hits)
        if num_hits > 0: print hits
        # Must convert hits to string to store these
        # non-scalars in first_df later on
        hits_str = ",".join(map(str, hits))
        all_hits.append(hits_str)
        # Store hits in first_df
    first_df["hits"] = all_hits
    print "Revised first_df: "
    print first_df

my_join(df1, df2)
```

Title: Pixels vs EM & Vertical Rhythm
Body:
Hi, 

Would you be interested in getting rid of Pixel measurements and taking a more flexible approach, using EM? 

For things like, for example Legend size, paddings for headings, alert blocks, buttons nav tabs. These things are more likely to be relative than absolute. 

Also, sizes of input controls, sizes or labels and many more things. All of them rely heavily on the base font size, and it will such an improvement to have all those things in a relative measurements (em) rather than absolute (px).

Title: Concurrent Reads of StringColumn Returning Zero-Length Strings
Body:
I was under the impression that concurrent reads were ok, but I've run into some strange behavior using PyTables and the multiprocessing module.  Here's some code that reproduces the problem almost every time I run it on my machine:

```
import numpy as np
from tables import *
from uuid import uuid4
from multiprocessing import Pool
import os


if __name__ == '__main__':

    class Data(IsDescription):
        n = StringCol(itemsize=10,pos=0)

    filename = '%s.h5' % str(uuid4())

    # create a new file
    hdf5 = openFile(filename,'w')
    hdf5.createTable('/','data',Data)
    table = hdf5.root.data
    newrow = table.row

    nrows = 500000

    # populate it with data
    for i in xrange(nrows):
        newrow['n'] = str(i)
        newrow.append()
    hdf5.flush()
    hdf5.close()
    print 'created file with %i rows' % nrows

    # re-open the file in read mode
    hdf5 = openFile(filename,'r')
    table = hdf5.root.data

    # define a "worker" to check values from the file
    def read(row):
        n = table[row]['n']
        val = str(n)
        try:
            assert val
        except AssertionError,e:
            print 'Bad val: %s' % val
            print 'Length: %i' % len(n)
            print 'Type: %s' % str(type(n))
            print '--------------------------'
            raise e
        return n

    # First, do the work in a single process to
    # prove that everything works as expected
    print 'trying with a single process'
    try:
        results = map(read,xrange(nrows))
    except AssertionError:
        print 'Value was missing in single process example'
        hdf5.close()
        os.remove(filename)
        exit()

    print 'single process example had no errors'

    # Next, try a multiprocess version
    print 'trying with multiple processes'
    try:
        # spawn some processes
        p = Pool(processes=2)
        results = p.map(read,xrange(nrows),chunksize=1000)
    except AssertionError:
        print 'Value was missing in multiprocess example'

    hdf5.close()
    os.remove(filename)
```

Title: Embedded media appears over elements.
Body:
This is a bit of a weird problem, especially because different browsers handle it differently. In browsers like Chromium, all embedded media acts as if it has a higher z-index than the top navigation bar. (fun fact: it's 1001)

Basically, embedded media just needs to be told in one way or another to not appear over the top bar, lightboxes, popup modals, and comment boxes. This is particularly bad on single-post views with embedded videos.

Title: GitHub Pages plays poorly with Handlebars
Body:
GitHub Pages seems like a very convenient and powerful platform for collaborative development and deployment of single-page (eg, Ember) apps.  Unfortunately, there is a small syntactic conflict: both Liquid (used by Jekyll) and Handlebars use the "{{ ... }}" notation.

Getting these strings past Liquid to Handlebars can be done, but it's a nuisance.  My current workaround, for example, is to use "{| ... |}" and "{|| ... ||}" in place of "{{ ... }}" and "{{{ ... }}}". This works for me, but I'm not looking forward to explaining it to others.  Assuming that I'm not simply missing some existing solution, I'm not sure how the problem should be resolved.

One possibility would be to support alternative syntax in Handlebars (like I do, informally), but this seems awkward and error-prone. A better approach might be to have some sort of syntax in Liquid that disables its interpretation of these strings for selected sections of a document.
repo_description: Liquid markup language. Safe, customer facing template language for flexible web apps.

Title: History.js breaks in IE7 in some cases because of beforeunload is fired
Body:
This problem takes me a long time to solve it!
History.js uses the beforeunload event to kill all Intervals running before the page is unloaded because of possible memory leaks. This is done in history.js Line 1833 (https://github.com/balupton/history.js/blob/master/scripts/uncompressed/history.js#L1833)

There is an issue with this event in IE7 so sometimes beforeunload is triggered when you are NOT leaving the page!
Look at this: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1658481/internet-explorer-calling-window-onbeforeunload-on-window-open-and-ajax-calls

This behavior breaks History.js functionallity completly in IE7 because all Intervals are killed and no hash-changes are detected anymore!

To solve this issue just remove history.js Line 1833. The following line of code 1834 (binding the same clearInterval function to the onunload event) is enough
repo_description: History.js gracefully supports the HTML5 History/State APIs (pushState, replaceState, onPopState) in all browsers. Including continued support for data, titles, replaceState. Supports jQuery, MooTools and Prototype.  For HTML5 browsers this means that you can modify the URL directly, without needing to use hashes anymore. For HTML4 browsers it will revert back to using the old onhashchange functionality.

Title: Download Progress for gzip encoded content
Body:
Sadly NSHTTPRequest doesn't return the gzip encoded NSData, there is no way to know how much data you received when fetching gzip encoded content.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3413774/how-do-i-track-the-download-progress-of-gzip-encoded-web-content says ASIHTTPRequest dig into CFNetwork to be able to give you a download progress status. Right now the only solution is disabling gzip completely, which is bad for iOS apps.

Any plan to be able to fix this progress download for gzip encoded content?

Title: Should we rename Void and Bottom?
Body:
We find that `Void` (the top of the hierarchy) is not adequatly named, since it conveys the idea that it can only point to nothing.

Similarly we find that `Bottom` (the subclass of every type) is confusing for those unfamiliar with the notion (everyone except ML guys).

We proposed the following alternatives:
- Top/Bottom
- Unknown/Impossible
- SuperType/SubType
- Anything/?
- Defined/Undefined
- Value/NonValue

Note that `undefined` is a valid value in many languages and would therefore be confusing.

Title: object may override a def causing ClassCastException in unrelated code
Body:
Given some class with a method

```scala
class A {
  def m() = 5
}
```

it is currently possible to override this method with an object definition:

```scala
class B extends A {
  object m
}
```

The compiler won't complain about this (and I'm not sure what the specification says about this specific situation), however the code will break wherever A is expected:

```scala
scala> ((new B): B).m    // compiles and runs
res: object B#m = B$m$@1e450448
scala> ((new B): A).m
java.lang.ClassCastException
```

As a possibly related phenomenon: It is currently not possible to override a parentheses-less def with an object.

```scala
class A2 {
  def m2 = 5
}
class B2 extends A2 {
  object m2
}
error: overriding method m in class A2 of type => Int;
 object m2 cannot be used here - classes and objects can only override abstract types
       class B2 extends A2 { object m2 }
                                  ^
```

Related: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/scala-user/TOuQ2-Jr_R8
Related: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7584400/overriding-a-method-with-an-object

Title: Reflection not working in 2.10 M2
Body:
Reflection appears to be broken on both M1 and M2. 

This Stackoverflow thread indicates that reflection was working in a snapshot build in October:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7477248/what-reflection-capabilities-can-we-expect-from-scala-2-10

```java
object Test extends Application {
  override def main(args: Array[String]) { 
    System.out.println("Running")
    case class Foo(a: Int, b: Int, c: Int)
    val props = reflect.mirror.classToType(classOf[Foo]).members.filter(_.isTerm)
    props foreach System.out.println
  }
}
```

via terminal invoking bin/scala directly:
/path/to/.scala-2.10.0-M2/bin/scala Test.scala

yields:
"java.lang.InternalError: Malformed class name"

via Scala-IDE 2.10.2 (downloaded this AM) I get:
"Scala reflection not available on this platform"

I would love to test reflection in 2.10 but am unable to do so.  Feedback appreciated, if reflection is not yet ready/working, please post in the release notes; otherwise, if it is in fact working, I'd love to know what is missing from my setup and/or wrong with the test case (that compiles just fine).

Thanks!
repo_description: official bug tracker for Scala 2 (the scala/scala repo)
bio: It's pronounced [ska-BUH], kind of like scabot.

Title: Custom Click Handlers Failing in OS X
Body:
I've built a webapp that calls preventDefault on navigation anchor clicks and instead uses Crossroads to parse the requested href and reload content with an AJAX callback. Hitting these links works for me with Selenium, but with Capybara-Webkit the custom handler that I've attached with jQuery.click() doesn't execute in OSX with qt4-mac (built with 'sudo port install qt4-mac'). The exact same tests work for me in our ci environment, which is running Ubuntu (using apt-get's libqt4-dev libqtwebkit-dev packages).

A forgotten comment on this StackOverflow thread suggests that I'm not the only one with this problem, but I also imagine that I'm not the only person who is overriding click behavior:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7616095/testing-jquery-dialog-with-capybara-webkit

Title: MapActivity yields ClassNotFoundException
Body:
Apparently to me, it seems that using `@EActivity` decorator on a MapActivity class is buggy. This is what I tried:

``` java
$ cat com/hello/annotations/HelloAnnotationsActivity.java 
package com.hello.annotations;

import com.google.android.maps.MapActivity;
import com.googlecode.androidannotations.annotations.EActivity;

@EActivity(R.layout.main)
public class HelloAnnotationsActivity extends MapActivity {

    @Override
    protected boolean isRouteDisplayed() {
        // TODO Auto-generated method stub
        return false;
    }

}
```

Layout:

``` html
$ cat ../res/layout/main.xml 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:id="@+id/main"
    android:layout_width="fill_parent"
    android:layout_height="fill_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical" >


<com.google.android.maps.MapView
    xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

    android:layout_width="fill_parent"
    android:layout_height="fill_parent"
    android:clickable="true"
    android:apiKey="$my-api-key$"
 />

</LinearLayout>
```

My Manifest:

``` html

$ cat ../AndroidManifest.xml 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    package="com.hello.annotations"
    android:versionCode="1"

    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET"/>

        android:icon="@drawable/ic_launcher"

                <category android:name="android.intent.category.LAUNCHER" />
            </intent-filter>

</manifest>
```

That generates:

```
$ cat ~/log.txt 
02-19 15:55:07.413: E/AndroidRuntime(333): FATAL EXCEPTION: main

Title: add global stdint.h support?
Body:
vs2010 does not include stdint.h support:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/126279/c99-stdint-h-header-and-ms-visual-studio

which causes addon bugs like this:

https://github.com/openframeworks/openFrameworks/issues/559
https://github.com/kylemcdonald/ofxCv/issues/28

even though these bugs aren't in the core, i think OF is designed to make it easy for people to write cross-platform, cross-compiler code. so i propose that we add an explicit declaration of the missing types for vs2010.

this isn't really something i'm worried about directly since i don't use vs2010, but i know people like elliot do. and it would be cleaner to add it once to the core than to add it once for every addon that is broken.

the solution would probably look like: take dan's code from the above issue, and move it from ofxOsc into the core.
repo_description: openFrameworks is a community-developed cross platform toolkit for creative coding in C++.

Title: destroy using dynamic finders does not destroy all translations
Body:
I thought this was a problem specific to my own code, but I just created a basic skeleton app and tried the same thing, and found the same issue, so I'm starting to think it's a problem with globalize3 itself.

If I create a model (`Post`) with a translated attribute (`title`) and set the title in two languages:

``` ruby
Globalize.locale = :en
post = Post.create(:title => "a title")
Globalize.locale = :ja
post.update_attributes(:title => "タイトル")
```

then get the post using a dynamic finder:

``` ruby
Globalize.locale = :en
post = Post.find_by_title("a title")
```

and then destroy it, it won't destroy the translation in the other language:

``` ruby
post.destroy
Post::Translation.all   # =>  [#<Post::Translation ... locale: "ja", title: "タイトル", ... >]
```

However, if instead of the dynamic finder you use a normal Post.find(<id>) on the id, then it works and properly destroys both translations.

Am I missing something here? Any help would be much appreciated.
repo_description: Rails I18n de-facto standard library for ActiveRecord model/data translation.
bio: Programmer, Writer, Speaker.

Title: data-rel=“back” with data-transition="none"
Body:
The issue is when the transition was set to none the functionality worked as expected except when the previous transition as set the none transition took precedence. Example:
- http://jsfiddle.net/ryanhaney/eLENj/

Click the Page-1 link on the home page the transition is set to slide. After navigating to Page-1 we have the footer navbar with three tab/page links. Clicking these we should see the none transition. Using the back button in the header tool bar I'm expecting the slide transition to take place but it looks like the none transition is still set.

I created a workaround the issue by resetting the changePage default transition to slide:
- http://jsfiddle.net/E86M9/3/

There should be a way to go back to the original transition the page/dialog was transitioned from by 

Related:
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9321655/jquery-mobile-data-rel-back-data-transition-does-not-work

Title: Running jQuery UI datepicker before applying bindings in a "with" breaks the datepicker
Body:
I'm not sure how widespread this issue is in general, but I'm having problems with jQuery UI's datepicker when applying bindings.

A JSFiddle repro is at http://jsfiddle.net/MRaKp/1/. Click the textboxes; the desired effect is for a datepicker to appear.

Three textboxes get datepicker applied to them:
- One inside a `data-bind="with: ..."` that gets `.datepicker()` applied before the `ko.applyBindings` call. This one breaks.
- One inside a `data-bind="with: ..."` that gets `.datepicker()` applied after the `ko.applyBindings` call. This one works.
- One outside a `data-bind="with: ..."` that gets `.datepicker()` applied before the `ko.applyBindings` call. This one works.

Using knockout-latest.

Title: Pylint and Pyrun doesn't work on Ubuntu 10.04 GVIM 7.3
Body:
On my Ubuntu 11.04 64bit with VIM 7.3, the version 0.5.8 doesn't work well, as PyLint always gives 0 quickfix and Pyrun outputs mixes up with "Error while processing function".
Here is a patch that works for me.

diff --git a/autoload/pymode/run.vim b/autoload/pymode/run.vim
index 23fc6a9..083fdbf 100644
--- a/autoload/pymode/run.vim
+++ b/autoload/pymode/run.vim
@@ -2,9 +2,10 @@
 fun! pymode#run#Run(line1, line2) "{{{
     if &modifiable && &modified | write | endif  
     redi @">
-    sil!py execfile(vim.eval('expand("%s:p")'))
-    !python %
   redi END
   call pymode#TempBuffer()
-    normal Pdd
-    normal P3dd
-    %s/
  //g
   wincmd p
  endfunction "}}}
  diff --git a/plugin/pymode.vim b/plugin/pymode.vim
  index 611c72f..1dd2941 100644
  --- a/plugin/pymode.vim
  +++ b/plugin/pymode.vim
  @@ -108,7 +108,7 @@ from pyflakes import checker
  # Pylint setup
  
  linter = lint.PyLinter()
  -pylint_re = re.compile('^(?:.:)?[^:]+:(\d+): [([EWRCI]+)[^]]_] (._)$')
  +pylint_re = re.compile('^(?P<type>[RCWEF]):\s_(?P<lineno>\d+),(?P<col>\d+):(?P<object>:)?(?P<message>._)$')
  
  checkers.initialize(linter)
  linter.load_file_configuration(vim.eval("g:pymode_lint_config"))
  @@ -126,12 +126,13 @@ def pylint():
   qf = []
   for w in linter.reporter.out.getvalue().split('\n'):
       test = pylint_re.match(w)
-        test and qf.append(dict(
-        if test:
-            qf.append(dict(
               filename = filename,
               bufnr = vim.current.buffer.number,
-                lnum = test.group(1),
-                type = test.group(2),
-                text = test.group(3).replace("'", "\""),
-                lnum = test.group('lineno'),
-                type = test.group('type'),
-                text = test.group('message').replace("'", "\""),
           ))
   vim.command('let b:qf_list = %s' % repr(qf))
repo_description: Vim python-mode. PyLint, Rope, Pydoc, breakpoints from box.
bio: A researcher and developer.

Best regards,
Johan
repo_description: The Sublime Text package manager

Title: disentangle source-control from packaging
Body:
Remove `git ls-files` from the gemspec.

I think this is one of those religious issues....

I get the value added of 'only release commited files'. But to me having git commands in your gemspec is a "code-smell" (these kids come up with crazy phrases). Essentially I'd argue you should be releasing a pure master or release branch, and that branch should have what is released, no-more-no-less. If you have files, etc that shouldn't be released these should be in the excludefiles for the development branch. Git's branching, squash commits, rebase etc means you can keep release/master neat while all the stuff that shouldn't be released is in the development branch.

See here for some details (no doubt google will throw up more): 
http://cogniton-mind.tumblr.com/post/1423976659/howto-gitignore-for-different-branches

My custom error handler means I can show users a nice error message and still log elmah errors. Removing it though meant the errors were no longer logged.

Does elmah.mvc deal with this issue in a different way and I've not configured it right, or is it out of the scope of this very excellent module.

Title: Including the Byte Order Mark (BOM)/Preamble for yml files breaks Ruby yml parsing
Body:
TL;DR:
Only add the UTF8 BOM/Preamble to .sln files.  Or only add the BOM to those files that originally contained it.

If you WarmuP a template that contains a .yml file, this line adds the Byte Order Mark/Preamble for UTF8: https://github.com/chucknorris/warmup/blob/master/warmup/TargetDir.cs#L82

The WriteAllText method that is currently being used writes the BOM as the first byte in the file.

Ruby's core yml library reads the BOM as part of the key (the yml is read..but the hash created contains the BOM...not so great...rails applications uses config.yml...it breaks stuff to say the least...)

Also, based on this StackOverflow answer, it is apparently not a good thing to add the BOM to xml files:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1317700/strip-byte-order-mark-from-string-in-c-sharp

The BOM is unfortunately required for .sln files so that VSSelector can open the solution and not crash.

Title: Enhancment: Add byte formating to CFormater
Body:
There are times were you need to provide a data size specified in bytes, such as a file upload, and would like to return an error based using said byte size in something more human readable than the actual byte number. example have byte size of 1400 and would like to display 1.4k. The code below can be plugged into CDateFormatter to add such support. The code came from a stackoverflow post and was attributed to Chris Jester-Young's and modified by Chris Himmelman. the url for the post is: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2510434/php-format-bytes-to-kilobytes-megabytes-gigabytes ``` /** * Formats the value as a human readable byte size. * @param mixed $value the value to be formatted * @param integer $precision the number of decimal points to include * @return string the formatted result */ public function formatBytes($size, $precision = 2) { $base = log($size) / log(1024); $suffixes = array('', 'k', 'M', 'G', 'T'); return round(pow(1024, $base - floor($base)), $precision) . $suffixes[floor($base)]; } ```

Migrated from http://code.google.com/p/yii/issues/detail?id=3179

earlier comments

alexander.makarow said, at 2012-02-09T19:29:58.000Z:

That's pretty common so I think it worth adding. One thing is that currently I don't know how to deal with i18n. CLDR doesn't have such data.

cebe.cc said, at 2012-02-13T19:20:30.000Z:

Seems as if this is a international standard, so there is no i18n: see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte#Unit_symbol and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SI_prefix

alexander.makarow said, at 2012-02-13T19:23:15.000Z:

Well, it's not. At least it's different in Russian.

cebe.cc said, at 2012-02-13T19:31:07.000Z:

Oh okay...

Title: Passenger processes hang on memcached poll, even with Rails.cache.reset stanza or in conservative spawn
Body:
Hoping to get some help on this recently-developed issue with our Passenger processes seizing up during or immediately following an exchange with memcached. We're set up on EC2, using m1.large: - Rails 3.1.1 - Ruby 1.9.2 - Apache2 / Passenger 3.0.11(both smart_lv2 and conservative spawn methods) - Couchbase 1.8, on its own m1.large - have seen this with dally 1.1.5 and 1.1.4 + kgio We're only using dalli for the Rails.cache (not for sessions), and are using the Passenger environment.rb stanza currently as below: `if defined?(PhusionPassenger) PhusionPassenger.on_event(:starting_worker_process) do |forked| Rails.cache.reset if forked end end` Over time, we can see our processes, using passenger-status, begin to seize up suddenly, eventually maxing out the pool and effectively shutting down passenger. This tends to happen in spurts--a box will be fine for a while, then lock up four or six processes, then coast by on the remaining processes for a while before eventually eating them all. We're stumped at the moment, in that this happens both on smart_lv2 and conservative spawning--the latter of which we had assumed would obviate any concerns at all about shared file descriptors. Watching strace, we see the processes talk to memcache successfully for a long while, ultimately ending in in a poll(), write(), read(), and then going silent. I'm hoping for any clues you might be able to offer on this, or, if I'm posting this in entirely the wrong place, a suggestion of somebody I'd be better off asking. Otherwise, thank you for the work on dalli--it's obviously been a great friend of ours through thick and thin. straces--both of a request that seized up, and of one of the many that worked--follow: Title: CLinkPager - Inconsistency in parameters
Body:
When using CLinkPager, first page (page=1) does not contain any parameter. All following pages would contain: page=2 page=3 ... which are submitted when switching between pages. This is the problem when trying to make filter remembered, because "not submitting the page parameter" means restoring previous page number from session. So when I come to page number 2, I can never switch to page 1, because the page=1 is never submitted. Would it be possible to add parameter "page" to navigation buttons by default always? The problem has also been discussed here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6788076/show-page-1-params-in-yii-clinkpager-first-page-link Thank you. Lubos

Migrated from http://code.google.com/p/yii/issues/detail?id=3032

Title: Add support for TextWatcher
Body:
It's possible with a `TextView` to get notified when some changes are made within it by implementing a TextWatcher and pass it to the instance of the `TextView`. This is largely used with `EditText` (extends `TextView`) to interact with user events on this view.

See TextWatcher interface here : http://developer.android.com/reference/android/text/TextWatcher.html
See EditText class here : http://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/EditText.html

I think we could introduce three new annotations : `@BeforeTextChanged` `@TextChanged` `@AfterTextChanged`

Title: Provide a way to pass in MongoOptions
Body:
I am writing a code that spawns ~200 threads and each thread performs a insert every ~2 seconds.

After a few minutes running I get this crash:

```
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.mongodb.DBPortPool$SemaphoresOut: Out of semaphores to get db connection
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(FutureTask.java:222)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:83)
    at clojure.core$future_call$reify__5684.deref(core.clj:6054)
    at clojure.core$deref.invoke(core.clj:2078)
    at legendas.core$cmap$step__1219$fn__1221.invoke(core.clj:93)
    at clojure.lang.LazySeq.sval(LazySeq.java:42)
```

I googled this error I found this stackoverflow thread:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6520439/how-to-configure-mongodb-java-driver-mongooptions-for-production-use

I seems that I need to increase the `threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier` but I am not sure how to do it in monger.

Thanks,
Cesar Canassa
repo_description: Monger is an idiomatic Clojure MongoDB driver with sane defaults, batteries included, well documented, low overhead

Title: Include -fobjc-arc linker flag if any pods are arc enabled
Body:
I ran into this bug today.  I have 2 pods that are arc enabled, but my project is not.  When running on a 4.3 device, I'd get errors like this:

```
Undefined symbols for architecture armv7:
"_objc_storeStrong", referenced from
```

There's some detail on this issue here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8756418/static-library-with-arc-support-linked-to-non-arc-project-causing-linker-errors

Apparently there's a bug in LLVM, and it may not automatically include the library that gives support to 4.3 devices.  You can force it by including the linker flag `-fobjc-arc` (note: linker flag for the target, not for an individual files).

I think CocoaPods could detect this scenario and add the appropriate setting in `Pods.xcconfig`.

I don't believe this is an issue if the main project is configured to use ARC.

Title: Cell content wrongly rendered in firefox
Body:
Firefox does not seem to be able to render cell contents correctly. Symptom is that cells with a number value (including formulas with a number result) do not seem to display their value.

Root cause seems to be that firefox ignores the "position:relative" of table cells, which makes the span inside the cells (which uses position:absolute) to be rendered off screen for numbers (which use right: 0px)

For details, see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9446137/html-table-with-rows-and-columns-that-can-be-sized-independently-of-cell-content

Title: Long polling / streaming updates
Body:
Having read your code, which is very nice otherwise, I notice a lack of [`yield`](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2922874/how-to-stream-an-httpresponse-with-django) statements which would be required to do long polling. Right now, it seems that the connection is closed after each response (whether a message is returned or not) - regardless of whether there's new data or not.

This leaves the major advantage of SSE unused. Especially for mobile devices creating TCP connections all the time can proof to be a considerable load. Also, it can slow down the interaction with the server.

Do note that I _might_ have been misreading your code - haven't found the time to use it yet. Then again, I _might_ opt to use your code in which I would implement the requested functionality myself.

Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2922874/how-to-stream-an-httpresponse-with-django
repo_description: HTML5 Server-Sent Events integration for Django

Title: Flash messages
Body:
This one is really for the design team.

Rails uses a feature called flash messages to communicate with the user. For example, if you log in but give the wrong password, it uses a flash message to tell the user that.

A place for these flash messages needs to be designed into every page.

Flash messages can be found in the templates using in the `flash` method. It returns a hash with possible keys of `:alert`, `:warning`, and `:error`.

The template needs to test whether there is a value for each of those keys and display it appropriately, for example, wrapped in a `div` with a class matching the type of flash message, plus styling.

Putting this in a partial template would keep the parent template cleaner.

Title: Document setMethods(null)
Body:
The PHPUnit call "setMethods()" can be called with "null" as an argument if you don't want to mock any methods on an object. This is useful if the only purpose you're mocking an object is so you can avoid calling its constructor, and you need to call a real method on that object to test it. See "http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9398284/creating-a-mock-in-phpunit-without-mocking-any-methods" for a discussion on this.

setMethods(null) isn't covered in the PHPUnit documentation, however, and it took me a long time to discover this useful functionality. Would you please give it a mention in the documentation?
repo_description: The PHP Unit Testing framework.

Title: Getting a 400 error when deauthorizing app
Body:
Using the Facebook C# API release version from 12/20/2011, I'm calling the facebook client Delete command with "/{facebook id}/permissions" I get a 400 Bad request returned to me. I've tried the following variations too: "{facebook id}/permissions", "/{app id}/permissions", "{app id}/permissions", "/{facebook id}/permission", "me/permissions" and "/{app id}/permission". I've issues other delete commands (such as deleting a comment, removing a like, and deleting a feed posting) thru the C# API with success. This documentation reference says you're to issue a delete command to {profile id}/permissions https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/rest/auth.revokeAuthorization/ I've tried using {facebook id}/permissions on the delete command via the Graph Api Explorer (https://developers.facebook.com/tools/explorer?method=DELETE) and it works there. So I'm confused why I'm only getting a 400 bad request for the removal of authorization. at FluentHttp.HttpHelper.OpenRead() in C:\temp\FBSDK-5.4.1.0.src\FacebookCSharpSDK\Source\Facebook\FluentHttp\HttpHelper.cs:line 693 at Facebook.FacebookClient.Api(String path, IDictionary`2 parameters, HttpMethod httpMethod, Type resultType) in C:\temp\FBSDK-5.4.1.0.src\FacebookCSharpSDK\Source\Facebook\FacebookClient.cs:line 458 at Facebook.HttpWebRequestWrapper.GetResponse() in C:\temp\FBSDK-5.4.1.0.src\FacebookCSharpSDK\Source\Facebook\FluentHttp\HttpHelper.cs:line 321 at FluentHttp.HttpHelper.OpenRead() in C:\temp\FBSDK-5.4.1.0.src\FacebookCSharpSDK\Source\Facebook\FluentHttp\HttpHelper.cs:line 672 https://graph.facebook.com:443/me/permissions?access_token=xxxx is the uri being passed into the CreateHttpWebRequest() method. Content type is "application/x-www-form-urlencoded". When _httpWebRequest.GetResponse(); is called, that's when a WebException is thrown in line 680 of HttpHelper.cs. "The remote server returned an error: (400) Bad Request." 400 Bad Request

Method Not Implemented

Invalid method in request

Which is a strange response because I can run the delete of permissions from the graph API explorer without getting this error. Migrated from Codeplex: http://facebooksdk.codeplex.com/workitem/5926
repo_description: Facebook SDK for .NET
bio: Product Manager at @salesforce. Contributor to @prettier. Formerly @auth0 & Microsoft @Azure.

Title: Use `$(el).val()` instead of `el.value` for compatibility with plugins that define custom `valHooks`
Body:
Example use case: https://github.com/mathiasbynens/jquery-placeholder/issues/29#issuecomment-4104352

In my placeholder plugin, I patch `val()` through `valHooks`, so that it only returns the element’s `value` if the fake placeholder text is not being displayed at that point. That way, as long as you use `.val()`, you get the exact same behavior as you would in a browser that has a native `placeholder` implementation.

It would be awesome if your validation plugin would use `$(el).val()` instead of `el.value`, as it would improve compatibility with plugins like this that define custom `valHooks`.
repo_description: jQuery Validation Plugin library sources
bio: Web standards fanatic. JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTTP, performance, security, Bash, Unicode, macOS.

Title: Ability to tell if the result of a findAll had any records from the adapter
Body:
Currently `DS.Store#findAll` returns an instance of `DS.ModelArray`, which does not include an `isLoaded` property.

Instead, `DS.Store#findAll` should return something that includes an `isLoaded` property.

When the adapter returns all the data for the `findAll`, the `isLoaded` property on the originally returned result of `DS.Store#findAll` should change to `true`.
repo_description: A data persistence library for Ember.js.

Title: Carrierwave and AWS server side encryption
Body:
I've been trying to work out if there is a way to use amazon's Server side encryption with carrierwave's fog support. basically to get a file to encrypt server side you simply need to include a header value of

 x-amz-server-side-encryption=AES256 

I detailed what I thought might work here: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9106115/adding-additional-headers-to-carrierwave-for-amazon-s3-encryption

but have since tested and it doesn't seem to. Anyone know how I can achieve this. 

Sorry if this is the wrong avenue for this question I couldn't find a mailing list.

Title: Error when sourcing activate.sh
Body:
This error message pops up on OSX (using Bash 4.2.20), OpenBSD (Bash 4.2.10) and Debian (Bash 3.2.39):

```
dirname: illegal option -- b
usage: dirname path
```

The problem, I think, stems from the difference between sourcing the file and running it as a script.

See: https://bitbucket.org/dhellmann/virtualenvwrapper/issue/7/virtualenv_wrapper_bin-causes-warning for the same problem and for a potential solution: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/59895/can-a-bash-script-tell-what-directory-its-stored-in.

Title: Random freeze when executing SYSCALL 5 under Java 7
Body:
Some users have reported some cases of freezing using the Oracle JRE version 7.

The following listing can be used to reproduce the problem:

```
.data
    text: .asciiz "Stampa di prova\n"
    params: .word 0

.code
    daddi r14, r0, params
    loop: syscall 5
    b loop
```

The problem can be seen with all the current jre1.7 versions, under both Windows and Linux.

Title:
Using 'br' as tag for Control causes 2
to be output
Body:
enyo.Control.prepareTags checks enyo.Control.selfClosing for an entry matching the tag of the Control. If it finds it, it won't render a closing tag; if not, it does. selfClosing is missing "br" (only contains "img" at the moment) so it renders both an opening and closing BR which gets interpreted (in Chrome at least) as 2 BRs.
seems to be the only one that causes a rendering issue so may not be significant to worry about the others (e.g. hr, link , meta)

Title: Wrong plural form of model names in other locales then :en
Body:
Model names can be translated using standard i18n setup, but the pluralization still uses the english standard (ending "s"). For example: "User" and "Users" would be "Bruger" and "Brugere" in danish (da), but in active admin it appears as "Bruger" and "Brugers". 

I have looked a bit around, and found that this can be fixed with a "hack fix" using inflections rules. This sounds like the inflection method pluralize is being used to pluralize the model names? It definitely looks like this is the method:

``` ruby
module ActiveAdmin
  class Resource
    module Naming
      #....
      def plural_resource_name
        @plural_resource_name ||= @options[:as].pluralize if @options[:as]
        @plural_resource_name ||= plural_human_name
        @plural_resource_name ||= resource_name.pluralize
      end
     #....
```

Correct me if wrong, but the method pluralize should not be used for translations, the rails inflector is mainly used for Rails internals, like guessing table names for models (see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6178900/overide-default-pluralize-for-model-name-in-rails3 for short explanation).

Title: Error with Sf2 console assetic:dump and JAVA path under Windows
Forcing a specific SSL version (for use with Mechanize)
Body:
Ehlo,

as pointed out in http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9150032/using-mechanize-or-even-nethttp-with-ruby-1-9-returns-opensslsslsslerro, some servers might have issues with renegotiating an SSL version, and so in that case it'd be more than handy to force a specific version right away when trying to establish a connection.

This is pretty much a feature request in the way of what the Net::HTTP object's ssl_version method does - so one would be able to use that particular functionality from the Mechanize gem via net-http-persistent (like, 'agent.ssl_version = "SSLv3"').

Cheers,
/astera
